trans-unit.source: Provides a mechanism that data-bound controls use to request data-related operations from data source controls when data is retrieved.
This class cannot be inherited.

Data-bound controls use the DataSourceSelectArguments class to request that a data source control performs additional data-related operations on a result set, such as sorting the data or returning a specific subset of data.
These data-related operations are enumerated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> enumeration.
The following table indicates how the DataSourceSelectArguments class supports these data-related operations.

|Capability|Related DataSourceSelectArguments properties| |----------------|--------------------------------------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A>| |<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName>|<xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A>| Data-bound controls explicitly call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataBoundControl.PerformSelect%2A> method to bind data, which calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method of the data source control they are associated with.
In this way, the data-bound control retrieves data from the data source control on demand.

Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method accepts a DataSourceSelectArguments parameter, the data-bound control is responsible for creating and managing a DataSourceSelectArguments object and passing it to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method when it retrieves data from the data source control.
In some cases, data-bound controls might not need any additional data-related capabilities.

In this case, data-bound controls pass an <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.Empty%2A> arguments object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.

For sorted result sets, data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanSort%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method.

As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a sorted result set from a data source control by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> property on the DataSourceSelectArguments object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.

For paging scenarios, data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method.

As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a subset of data from a data source control for paging by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties on the DataSourceSelectArguments object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.

To retrieve a total row count for paging scenarios, data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method.

As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a total row count from a data source control for paging by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A> property on the DataSourceSelectArguments object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method returns, the total row count is contained by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property.

> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the DataSourceSelectArguments properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.
Initializes a new default instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> class.

The default constructor creates an instance of the class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> property initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties initialized to zero.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> class with the specified sort expression.

The DataSourceSelectArguments constructor creates an instance of the class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> initialized with the specified expression and the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties initialized to zero.
A sort expression that data source controls use to sort the result of a data retrieval operation before the result is returned to a caller.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> class with the specified starting position and number of rows to return for paging scenarios.

The DataSourceSelectArguments constructor creates an instance of the class with the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> initialized to <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties initialized to the values provided for the `startRowIndex` and `maximumRows` parameters.
The index of the data row that marks the beginning of data returned by a data retrieval operation.
The maximum number of rows that a data retrieval operation returns.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> class with the specified sort expression, starting position, and number of rows to return for paging scenarios.
A sort expression that data source controls use to sort the result of a data retrieval operation before the result is returned to a caller.
The index of the data row that marks the beginning of data returned by a data retrieval operation.
The maximum number of rows that a data retrieval operation returns.
Adds one capability to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> instance, which is used to compare supported capabilities and requested capabilities.
Data source controls call the AddSupportedCapabilities method for each capability the data source supports.

After the capabilities are added, any call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29> method compares the supported capabilities against the requested capabilities (represented by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> properties).

For example, if a capability such as <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> is not added but the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A> property is set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29> method throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities"></xref> values.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object with the sort expression set to <xref:System.String.Empty>.
The property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object created with the default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.%23ctor> constructor.

You can use the Empty property when you want to call the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%29> method of a data source view class without any additional arguments.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> object.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> instance is equal to the current instance.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class overrides the <xref:System.Object.Equals%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to test equality using the various properties of the objects.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RetrieveTotalRowCount%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.SortExpression%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> properties are all equal in value, the Equals method returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> to compare with the current one.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> is equal to the current instance; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns the hash code for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> type.
The hash code for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> type.
Gets or sets a value that represents the maximum number of data rows that a data source control returns for a data retrieval operation.
The MaximumRows property supports paging scenarios.

Data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method if the view supports paging.

If the data-bound control fails to add the capability, and the paging properties are set on a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the data source view during a data retrieval operation, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception might be thrown.

The data-bound control can request a subset of data from a data source control for paging by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.StartRowIndex%2A> and MaximumRows properties on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29> method.

> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.
The maximum number of data rows that a data source returns for a data retrieval operation.
The default value is 0, which indicates that all possible data rows are returned.

Compares the capabilities requested for an <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%29> operation against those that the specified data source view supports.

The RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError method is used by data-bound controls to compare additional requested capabilities represented by the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> class, such as the ability to sort or page through a result set, with the capabilities supported by the data source view.

The view calls its own <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilityError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method for each possible capability defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities> enumeration.

> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError method is called.
The data source view that performs the data retrieval operation.
The data source view does not support the data source capability specified.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a data source control should retrieve a count of all the data rows during a data retrieval operation.
The RetrieveTotalRowCount property supports paging scenarios.
Set this property to `true` to request a total row count from the data source control during the data-retrieval operation.
Check the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether a data source view supports retrieving a total row count.

If the data source supports it, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property is set by the data source control during the course of a data retrieval operation and the total data row count is returned in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.TotalRowCount%2A> property, much as a value is returned in an output parameter of a method.

> [!IMPORTANT] > If any of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> properties are set, but the currently bound data source control does not support the requested capability, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.RaiseUnsupportedCapabilitiesError%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceView%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the data source control should retrieve a total data row count; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets an expression that the data source view uses to sort the data retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The SortExpression property supports sorting scenarios.

A string that the data source view uses to sort data retrieved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
<xref:System.String.Empty> is returned if sort expression has not been set.
Gets or sets a value that represents the starting position the data source control should use when retrieving data rows during a data retrieval operation.
The StartRowIndex property supports paging scenarios.

Data-bound controls check a data source view's <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanPage%2A> property at run time, and add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities?displayProperty=fullName> capability using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.AddSupportedCapabilities%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceCapabilities%29> method if the view supports paging.

If the data-bound control fails to add the capability, and the paging properties are set on a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the data source view during a data retrieval operation, an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception might be thrown.

As a separate operation, the data-bound control can request a subset of data from a data source control by setting the StartRowIndex and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments.MaximumRows%2A> properties on the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments> object passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.Select%28System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments%2CSystem.Web.UI.DataSourceViewSelectCallback%29?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The starting row position from which a data source control retrieves data.
The default value is 0, which indicates that the starting position is the beginning of the result set.
Gets or sets the number of rows retrieved during a data retrieval operation.
The TotalRowCount property supports paging scenarios.
Data source and data source view controls differ in their internal implementation for how to retrieve total row counts.

Check the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceView.CanRetrieveTotalRowCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether a data source view supports retrieving a total row count during a data-retrieval operation.

If the data source supports it, the TotalRowCount property is set by the data source control during the course of a data-retrieval operation, and the total data row count is returned in the TotalRowCount property, much as a value is returned in an output parameter of a method.
The total number of data rows retrieved by the data retrieval operation.
